001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui;
002
003import java.awt.AlphaComposite;
004import java.awt.Color;
005import java.awt.Composite;
006import java.awt.Dimension;
007import java.awt.Font;
008import java.awt.Graphics;
009import java.awt.Graphics2D;
010import java.awt.Point;
011import java.awt.Toolkit;
012import java.awt.image.BufferedImage;
013import java.util.LinkedList;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue;
016import javax.swing.JLayeredPane;
017import squidpony.SColor;
018import squidpony.squidgrid.gui.animation.Animation;
019import squidpony.squidgrid.gui.animation.AnimationManager;
020import squidpony.squidgrid.gui.animation.BumpAnimation;
021import squidpony.squidgrid.gui.animation.SlideAnimation;
022import squidpony.squidgrid.gui.animation.WiggleAnimation;
023import squidpony.squidgrid.Direction;
024
025/**
026 * Displays text and images in a grid pattern. Supports basic animations.
027 * 
028 * Grid width and height settings are in terms of number of cells. Cell width and height
029 * are in terms of number of pixels.
030 *
031 * When text is placed, the background color is set separately from the foreground character. When moved, only the
032 * foreground character is moved.
033 *
034 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
035 */
036public class SquidPanel extends JLayeredPane {
037
038    private static int DEFAULT_ANIMATION_DURATION = 200;
039    private static Font DEFAULT_FONT = new Font("Helvetica", Font.PLAIN, 22);
040    private AnimationManager animationManager;
041    private final ConcurrentLinkedQueue<Animation> animations = new ConcurrentLinkedQueue<>();
042    private BufferedImage[][] contents;
043    private boolean[][] imageChanged;
044    private BufferedImage contentsImage = new BufferedImage(20, 20, BufferedImage.TYPE_4BYTE_ABGR);
045    private Color defaultForeground = SColor.WHITE;
046    private final int gridWidth, gridHeight, cellWidth, cellHeight;
047    private Dimension panelDimension;
048    private final TextCellFactory textFactory;
049    private final ImageCellMap imageCellMap;
050    
051    /**
052     * Creates a bare-bones panel with all default values for text rendering.
053     * 
054     * @param gridWidth the number of cells horizontally
055     * @param gridHeight the number of cells vertically
056     */
057    public SquidPanel(int gridWidth, int gridHeight) {
058        this(gridWidth, gridHeight, new TextCellFactory().font(DEFAULT_FONT), null);
059    }
060
061    /**
062     * Creates a panel with the given grid and cell size. Uses a default font.
063     *
064     * @param gridWidth the number of cells horizontally
065     * @param gridHeight the number of cells vertically
066     * @param cellWidth the number of horizontal pixels in each cell
067     * @param cellHeight the number of vertical pixels in each cell
068     */
069    public SquidPanel(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, int cellWidth, int cellHeight) {
070        this(gridWidth, gridHeight, new TextCellFactory().font(DEFAULT_FONT).width(cellWidth).height(cellHeight), null);
071    }
072
073    /**
074     * Builds a panel with the given grid size and all other parameters determined by the factory. Even if sprite images
075     * are being used, a TextCellFactory is still needed to perform sizing and other utility functions.
076     * 
077     * If the TextCellFactory has not yet been initialized, then it will be sized based on its font. If it is null
078     * then a default one will be created and initialized.
079     *
080     * For proper display, The imageMap (if not null) should have the same cell size as the factory.
081     *
082     * @param gridWidth the number of cells horizontally
083     * @param gridHeight the number of cells vertically
084     * @param factory the factory to use for cell rendering
085     * @param imageMap can be null if no explicit images will be used
086     */
087    public SquidPanel(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, TextCellFactory factory, ImageCellMap imageMap) {
088        this.gridWidth = gridWidth;
089        this.gridHeight = gridHeight;
090        textFactory = factory;
091        
092        if (factory == null) {
093            factory = new TextCellFactory();
094        }
095        
096        if (!factory.initialized()) {
097            factory.initByFont();
098        }
099        
100        cellWidth = factory.width();
101        cellHeight = factory.height();
102        setFont(textFactory.font());
103        if (imageMap == null) {
104            imageCellMap = new ImageCellMap(cellWidth, cellHeight);
105        } else {
106            imageCellMap = imageMap;
107        }
108
109        setOpaque(false);
110        contents = new BufferedImage[gridWidth][gridHeight];
111        imageChanged = new boolean[gridWidth][gridHeight];
112        for (int x = 0; x < gridWidth; x++) {
113            for (int y = 0; y < gridHeight; y++) {
114                imageChanged[x][y] = true;
115            }
116        }
117        int w = gridWidth * cellWidth;
118        int h = gridHeight * cellHeight;
119        panelDimension = new Dimension(w, h);
120        setSize(panelDimension);
121        setMinimumSize(panelDimension);
122        setPreferredSize(panelDimension);
123        contentsImage = new BufferedImage(w, h, BufferedImage.TYPE_4BYTE_ABGR);
124        redraw();
125        repaint();
126    }
127
128    /**
129     * Returns the image being displayed at the given coordinates. Because this is the actual image and not a copy, any
130     * changes to it will be reflected in the original during the next GUI update.
131     *
132     * @param x
133     * @param y
134     * @return
135     */
136    public BufferedImage getImage(int x, int y) {
137        return contents[x][y];
138    }
139
140    @Override
141    public void paintComponent(Graphics g) {
142        super.paintComponent(g);
143        g.drawImage(contentsImage, 0, 0, null);
144        paintComponents(g);
145        //TODO: The next line may be needed for animations, but it causes flickering with SquidLayers.
146//        Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().sync();
147    }
148
149    /**
150     * Places the given characters into the grid starting at 0,0.
151     *
152     * @param chars
153     */
154    public void put(char[][] chars) {//TODO - convert this to work with code points
155        SquidPanel.this.put(0, 0, chars);
156    }
157
158    public void put(char[][] chars, Color[][] foregrounds) {//TODO - convert this to work with code points
159        SquidPanel.this.put(0, 0, chars, foregrounds);
160    }
161
162    public void put(char[][] chars, int[][] indices, List<Color> palette) {//TODO - convert this to work with code points
163        SquidPanel.this.put(0, 0, chars, indices, palette);
164    }
165
166    public void put(int x, int y, BufferedImage image) {
167        contents[x][y] = image;
168        imageChanged[x][y] = true;
169    }
170
171    public void putImage(int x, int y, String key) {
172        BufferedImage image = imageCellMap.get(key);
173        if (image == null) {
174            image = imageCellMap.getNullImage();
175        }
176        contents[x][y] = image;
177        imageChanged[x][y] = true;
178    }
179
180    public void put(int xOffset, int yOffset, char[][] chars) {
181        SquidPanel.this.put(xOffset, yOffset, chars, defaultForeground);
182    }
183
184    public void put(int xOffset, int yOffset, char[][] chars, Color[][] foregrounds) {
185        for (int x = xOffset; x < xOffset + chars.length; x++) {
186            for (int y = yOffset; y < yOffset + chars[0].length; y++) {
187                if (x >= 0 && y >= 0 && x < gridWidth && y < gridHeight) {//check for valid input
188                    SquidPanel.this.put(x, y, chars[x - xOffset][y - yOffset], foregrounds[x - xOffset][y - yOffset]);
189                }
190            }
191        }
192    }
193
194    public void put(int xOffset, int yOffset, char[][] chars, int[][] indices, List<Color> palette) {
195        for (int x = xOffset; x < xOffset + chars.length; x++) {
196            for (int y = yOffset; y < yOffset + chars[0].length; y++) {
197                if (x >= 0 && y >= 0 && x < gridWidth && y < gridHeight) {//check for valid input
198                    SquidPanel.this.put(x, y, chars[x - xOffset][y - yOffset], palette.get(indices[x - xOffset][y - yOffset]));
199                }
200            }
201        }
202    }
203
204    public void put(int xOffset, int yOffset, Color[][] foregrounds) {
205        for (int x = xOffset; x < xOffset + foregrounds.length; x++) {
206            for (int y = yOffset; y < yOffset + foregrounds[0].length; y++) {
207                if (x >= 0 && y >= 0 && x < gridWidth && y < gridHeight) {//check for valid input
208                    SquidPanel.this.put(x, y, textFactory.getSolid(foregrounds[x - xOffset][y - yOffset]));
209                }
210            }
211        }
212    }
213
214    public void put(int xOffset, int yOffset, int[][] indices, List<Color> palette) {
215        for (int x = xOffset; x < xOffset + indices.length; x++) {
216            for (int y = yOffset; y < yOffset + indices[0].length; y++) {
217                if (x >= 0 && y >= 0 && x < gridWidth && y < gridHeight) {//check for valid input
218                    SquidPanel.this.put(x, y, textFactory.getSolid(palette.get(indices[x - xOffset][y - yOffset])));
219                }
220            }
221        }
222    }
223
224    public void put(int xOffset, int yOffset, char[][] chars, Color foreground) {
225        for (int x = xOffset; x < xOffset + chars.length; x++) {
226            for (int y = yOffset; y < yOffset + chars[0].length; y++) {
227                if (x >= 0 && y >= 0 && x < gridWidth && y < gridHeight) {//check for valid input
228                    SquidPanel.this.put(x, y, chars[x - xOffset][y - yOffset], foreground);
229                }
230            }
231        }
232    }
233
234    /**
235     * Puts the given string horizontally with the first character at the given offset.
236     *
237     * Does not word wrap. Characters that are not renderable (due to being at negative offsets or offsets greater than
238     * the grid size) will not be shown but will not cause any malfunctions.
239     *
240     * Will use the default color for this component to draw the characters.
241     *
242     * @param xOffset the x coordinate of the first character
243     * @param yOffset the y coordinate of the first character
244     * @param string the characters to be displayed
245     */
246    public void put(int xOffset, int yOffset, String string) {
247        SquidPanel.this.put(xOffset, yOffset, string, defaultForeground);
248    }
249
250    /**
251     * Puts the given string horizontally with the first character at the given offset.
252     *
253     * Does not word wrap. Characters that are not renderable (due to being at negative offsets or offsets greater than
254     * the grid size) will not be shown but will not cause any malfunctions.
255     *
256     * @param xOffset the x coordinate of the first character
257     * @param yOffset the y coordinate of the first character
258     * @param string the characters to be displayed
259     * @param foreground the color to draw the characters
260     */
261    public void put(int xOffset, int yOffset, String string, Color foreground) {//TODO - make this work with code points
262        char[][] temp = new char[string.length()][1];
263        for (int i = 0; i < string.length(); i++) {
264            temp[i][0] = string.charAt(i);
265        }
266        SquidPanel.this.put(xOffset, yOffset, temp, foreground);
267    }
268
269    /**
270     * Puts the given string horizontally with the first character at the given offset.
271     *
272     * Does not word wrap. Characters that are not renderable (due to being at negative offsets or offsets greater than
273     * the grid size) will not be shown but will not cause any malfunctions.
274     *
275     * Will use the default color for this component to draw the characters.
276     *
277     * @param xOffset the x coordinate of the first character
278     * @param yOffset the y coordinate of the first character
279     * @param string the characters to be displayed
280     * @param vertical true if the text should be written vertically, from top to bottom
281     */
282    public void placeVerticalString(int xOffset, int yOffset, String string, boolean vertical) {
283        SquidPanel.this.put(xOffset, yOffset, string, defaultForeground, vertical);
284    }
285
286    /**
287     * Puts the given string horizontally with the first character at the given offset.
288     *
289     * Does not word wrap. Characters that are not renderable (due to being at negative offsets or offsets greater than
290     * the grid size) will not be shown but will not cause any malfunctions.
291     *
292     * @param xOffset the x coordinate of the first character
293     * @param yOffset the y coordinate of the first character
294     * @param string the characters to be displayed
295     * @param foreground the color to draw the characters
296     * @param vertical true if the text should be written vertically, from top to bottom
297     */
298    public void put(int xOffset, int yOffset, String string, Color foreground, boolean vertical) {//TODO - make this use any Direction
299        if (vertical) {
300            SquidPanel.this.put(xOffset, yOffset, new char[][]{string.toCharArray()}, foreground);
301        } else {
302            SquidPanel.this.put(xOffset, yOffset, string, foreground);
303        }
304    }
305
306    /**
307     * Erases the entire panel, leaving only a transparent space.
308     */
309    public void erase() {
310        Graphics2D g = contentsImage.createGraphics();
311
312        Composite c = g.getComposite();
313        g.setComposite(AlphaComposite.Clear);
314        g.fillRect(0, 0, getWidth(), getHeight());
315        g.setComposite(c);
316
317        redraw();
318    }
319
320    /**
321     * Removes the contents of this cell, leaving a transparent space.
322     *
323     * @param x
324     * @param y
325     */
326    public void clear(int x, int y) {
327        this.put(x, y, SColor.TRANSPARENT);
328    }
329
330    public void put(int x, int y, Color color) {
331        put(x, y, textFactory.getSolid(color));
332    }
333
334    public void put(int x, int y, char c) {
335        put(x, y, c, defaultForeground);
336    }
337
338    /**
339     * Takes a unicode codepoint for input.
340     *
341     * @param x
342     * @param y
343     * @param code
344     */
345    public void put(int x, int y, int code) {
346        put(x, y, code, defaultForeground);
347    }
348
349    public void put(int x, int y, char c, Color color) {
350        put(x, y, (int) c, color);
351    }
352
353    public void put(int x, int y, int index, List<Color> palette) {
354        put(x, y, palette.get(index));
355    }
356
357    public void put(int x, int y, char c, int index, List<Color> palette) {
358        put(x, y, (int) c, palette.get(index));
359    }
360
361    /**
362     * Takes a unicode codepoint for input.
363     *
364     * @param x
365     * @param y
366     * @param code
367     * @param color
368     */
369    public void put(int x, int y, int code, Color color) {
370        if (x < 0 || x >= gridWidth || y < 0 || y >= gridHeight) {
371            return;//skip if out of bounds
372        }
373        contents[x][y] = textFactory.get(code, color);
374        imageChanged[x][y] = true;
375    }
376
377    public int cellWidth() {
378        return cellWidth;
379    }
380
381    public int cellHeight() {
382        return cellHeight;
383    }
384
385    public int gridHeight() {
386        return gridHeight;
387    }
388
389    public int gridWidth() {
390        return gridWidth;
391    }
392
393    /**
394     * Cause everything that has been prepared for drawing (such as with put) to actually be drawn.
395     */
396    public void refresh() {
397        trimAnimations();
398        redraw();
399        repaint();
400    }
401
402    /**
403     * A low-level check to see if a particular cell has been updated since the last draw. Not intended for general use.
404     * @param x
405     * @param y
406     * @return
407     */
408    public boolean hasChanged(int x, int y)
409    {
410        return imageChanged[x][y];
411    }
412    private void redraw() {
413        Graphics2D g = contentsImage.createGraphics();
414
415        for (int x = 0; x < gridWidth; x++) {
416            for (int y = 0; y < gridHeight; y++) {
417                if (imageChanged[x][y]) {
418                    Composite c = g.getComposite();
419                    g.setComposite(AlphaComposite.Clear);
420                    g.fillRect(x * cellWidth, y * cellHeight, cellWidth, cellHeight);
421                    g.setComposite(c);
422
423                    if (contents[x][y] != null) {
424                        g.drawImage(contents[x][y], null, x * cellWidth, y * cellHeight);
425                    }
426                    imageChanged[x][y] = false;
427                }
428            }
429        }
430    }
431
432    public void setDefaultForeground(Color defaultForeground) {
433        this.defaultForeground = defaultForeground;
434    }
435
436    /**
437     * Starts a bumping animation in the direction provided.
438     *
439     * @param location
440     * @param direction
441     */
442    public void bump(Point location, Direction direction) {
443        if (contents[location.x][location.y] != null) {
444            int duration = 20;
445            Animation anim = new BumpAnimation(contents[location.x][location.y], new Point(location.x * cellWidth, location.y * cellHeight), new Dimension(cellWidth / 3, cellHeight / 3), direction, duration);
446            contents[location.x][location.y] = null;
447            imageChanged[location.x][location.y] = true;
448            redraw();
449            animations.add(anim);
450            if (animationManager == null) {
451                animationManager = AnimationManager.startNewAnimationManager(this);
452            }
453            animationManager.add(anim);
454        }
455    }
456
457    /**
458     * Starts a movement animation for the object at the given grid location at the default speed.
459     *
460     * @param start
461     * @param end
462     */
463    public void slide(Point start, Point end) {
464        slide(start, end, DEFAULT_ANIMATION_DURATION);
465    }
466
467    /**
468     * Starts a movement animation for the object at the given grid location at the default speed for one grid square in
469     * the direction provided.
470     *
471     * @param start
472     * @param direction
473     */
474    public void slide(Point start, Direction direction) {
475        slide(start, new Point(direction.deltaX + start.x, direction.deltaY + start.y), DEFAULT_ANIMATION_DURATION);
476    }
477
478    /**
479     * Starts a sliding movement animation for the object at the given location at the provided speed. The duration is
480     * how many milliseconds should pass for the entire animation.
481     *
482     * @param start
483     * @param end
484     * @param duration
485     */
486    public void slide(Point start, Point end, int duration) {
487        if (contents[start.x][start.y] != null) {
488            Animation anim = new SlideAnimation(contents[start.x][start.y], new Point(start.x * cellWidth, start.y * cellHeight), new Point(end.x * cellWidth, end.y * cellHeight), duration);
489            contents[start.x][start.y] = null;
490            imageChanged[start.x][start.y] = true;
491            redraw();
492            animations.add(anim);
493            if (animationManager == null) {
494                animationManager = AnimationManager.startNewAnimationManager(this);
495            }
496            animationManager.add(anim);
497        }
498    }
499
500    /**
501     * Starts an wiggling animation for the object at the given location.
502     *
503     * @param location
504     */
505    public void wiggle(Point location) {
506        if (contents[location.x][location.y] != null) {
507            Animation anim = new WiggleAnimation(contents[location.x][location.y], new Point(location.x * cellWidth, location.y * cellHeight), 0.3, new Point(cellWidth / 4, cellHeight / 4), 160);
508            contents[location.x][location.y] = null;
509            imageChanged[location.x][location.y] = true;
510            redraw();
511            animations.add(anim);
512            if (animationManager == null) {
513                animationManager = AnimationManager.startNewAnimationManager(this);
514            }
515            animationManager.add(anim);
516        }
517    }
518
519    /**
520     * Drops any finished animations from the animation list.
521     */
522    private void trimAnimations() {
523        if (animationManager == null) {
524            return;//no manager means nothing to trim
525        }
526        LinkedList<Animation> removals = new LinkedList<>();
527        for (Animation anim : animations) {
528            if (!anim.isActive()) {
529                removals.add(anim);
530            }
531        }
532        animations.removeAll(removals);
533        for (Animation anim : removals) {
534            animationManager.stopAnimation(anim);
535            anim.remove();
536            contents[anim.getLocation().x / cellWidth][anim.getLocation().y / cellHeight] = anim.getImage();
537            imageChanged[anim.getLocation().x / cellWidth][anim.getLocation().y / cellHeight] = true;
538        }
539    }
540
541    /**
542     * Causes the component to stop responding to input until all current animations are finished.
543     *
544     * Note that if an animation is set to not stop then this method will never return.
545     */
546    public void waitForAnimations() {
547        while (!animations.isEmpty()) {
548            trimAnimations();
549        }
550        redraw();
551        repaint();
552    }
553
554    /**
555     * Returns true if there are animations running when this method is called.
556     *
557     * Note that due to the nature of animations ending at various times, this result is not guaranteed to be accurate.
558     *
559     * To fully ensure no animations are running, waitForAnimations() must be used.
560     *
561     * @return
562     */
563    public boolean hasActiveAnimations() {
564        return animations == null ? false : !animations.isEmpty();
565    }
566
567}
